                        Supply Chain Manager Job at natnudO




        
    

        
        natnudO has been revolutionizing the poultry industry for over 10 years. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the Nigerian market’s demand for high-quality animal protein. We provide a full range of high-quality, tasty animal protein products to satisfy our growing market. Our products offer great value for money while strictly following global best practices for food processing.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We maintain a high level of organizational excellence in all aspects of our business, from production to distribution, until the products get to our esteemed consumers. Every product is carefully processed and packaged according to the highest global health standards. All our products are NAFDAC and SON certified. natnudO Foods is growing to provide a diverse range of protein products for all our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Manager
Job Location: Awe, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Are you a strategic thinker with hands-on experience in supply chain leadership? 
	Do you thrive in dynamic environments where agility, efficiency, and operational excellence are key drivers of success?
	We are looking for a high-performing Supply Chain Manager to oversee and optimize our end-to-end supply chain operations - from procurement and production planning to inventory management and distribution. 
	The ideal candidate will ensure that our products reach the right place at the right time, in the right quantity, and at optimal cost.


Job Purpose


	To lead and manage the entire supply chain function at natnudO Foods, ensuring operational efficiency, cost-effectiveness, compliance, and customer satisfaction through streamlined supply chain activities.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Supply Chain Management:


	Develop and implement comprehensive supply chain strategies aligned with the company’s business objectives.
	Drive continuous improvement and efficiency across the supply chain network.


Planning and Forecasting:


	Collaborate with procurement, production, and sales teams to forecast demand and align supply plans accordingly.
	Ensure accurate production planning to meet market demand while managing inventory cost-effectively.


Procurement and Supplier Management:


	Identify, evaluate, and manage relationships with suppliers to ensure quality, price competitiveness, and reliability.
	Negotiate contracts to secure favourable terms while reducing risk and ensuring uninterrupted supply.


Inventory and Distribution:


	Optimize inventory levels to avoid stockouts and overstock situations.
	Oversee warehouse and distribution activities to ensure timely and accurate delivery of products.


Performance Monitoring:


	Implement and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for supply chain functions such as lead time, fulfilment rate, cost-to-serve, and supplier performance.
	Utilize data and analytics to improve service levels and reduce supply chain costs.


Compliance and Risk Management:


	Ensure adherence to food safety standards, company policies, and industry regulations throughout the supply chain.
	Identify supply chain risks, bottlenecks, and operational challenges and develop effective mitigation strategies.


Team Leadership:


	Lead, mentor, and develop a cross-functional supply chain team to build in-house capabilities and foster a high-performance culture.
	Promote collaboration, accountability, and innovation within the team.


Educational Qualification & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or any related field.
	Minimum of 6 - 8 years of progressive experience in supply chain or operations management.
	Professional certifications such as APICS, CIPS, or equivalent are an added advantage.
	Prior experience in food manufacturing, agro-processing, or FMCG is highly preferred.
	Proven ability to manage supplier relationships, drive cost reduction initiatives, and improve supply chain efficiencies.


Key Skills and Competencies:


	Strong analytical and negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in ERP systems, inventory management, and data analytics tools.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management abilities.
	Strong organizational and time management skills.
	Ability to work under pressure, manage competing priorities, and make data-driven decisions.
	In-depth knowledge of logistics, procurement, and warehouse operations.


Expected Behavioural Competencies:


	Accountability.
	Integrity.
	Resourcefulness.
	Dependability.
	Passion.
	Promptness.
	Team Leadership.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: vacancies@afshltd.com using "Application for Supply Chain Manager" as the subject of the email.

                        Inventory Manager Job at natnudO




        
    

        
        natnudO has been revolutionizing the poultry industry for over 10 years. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the Nigerian market’s demand for high-quality animal protein. We provide a full range of high-quality, tasty animal protein products to satisfy our growing market. Our products offer great value for money while strictly following global best practices for food processing.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We maintain a high level of organizational excellence in all aspects of our business, from production to distribution, until the products get to our esteemed consumers. Every product is carefully processed and packaged according to the highest global health standards. All our products are NAFDAC and SON certified. natnudO Foods is growing to provide a diverse range of protein products for all our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Manager

Job Location: Akinyele, Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To efficiently manage and optimize the company's inventory levels, ensuring accurate record-keeping, stock availability, loss prevention, and effective coordination between procurement, production, and sales departments. 
	The role is critical in minimizing inventory costs while ensuring production continuity and timely order fulfillment.


Key Roles and Responsibilities
Inventory Planning & Management:


	Develop and implement inventory control systems and practices to manage raw materials, packaging, WIP (work-in-progress), and finished goods.
	Maintain optimal inventory levels across multiple storage locations to support production and sales activities.
	Ensure alignment between demand forecasting, inventory levels, and supply planning.
	Monitor and track all stock movements using ERP systems and generate regular inventory reports.
	Coordinate and reconcile physical stock counts with system records, investigating and resolving discrepancies.


Warehouse & Stock Operations:


	Oversee warehouse layout and storage systems to optimize space and improve material flow.
	Ensure FIFO (First In First Out) and FEFO (First Expiry First Out) inventory principles are enforced.
	Establish and enforce safety and hygiene standards across all storage facilities.
	Collaborate with warehouse teams to ensure accurate labeling, stacking, and handling of goods.


Data Management & Reporting:


	Generate and interpret reports related to inventory accuracy, turnover, slow-moving items, shrinkage, and obsolete stock.
	Provide actionable insights to management based on stock trends and performance metrics.
	Develop KPIs and dashboards for inventory performance tracking.


Team Management & Collaboration:


	Supervise inventory and warehouse staff, including performance monitoring and training.
	Work closely with procurement, production, quality control, logistics, and sales departments to ensure cross-functional alignment.
	Ensure clear documentation, stock traceability, and compliance with internal and external audit requirements.


Process Improvement & Compliance:


	Continuously improve inventory processes and implement best practices to increase efficiency and reduce losses.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, food safety regulations, and audit standards.
	Implement controls to prevent theft, spoilage, and inventory-related risks.


Education and Qualifications


	B.Sc./HND in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, Accounting, or a related field.
	Professional certifications in inventory, warehouse, or supply chain management (e.g., APICS, CIPS, CILT) are an added advantage.


Experience Required:


	Minimum of 5–7 years of relevant experience in inventory or warehouse management, preferably in the FMCG or food manufacturing sector.
	Strong understanding of ERP systems and inventory software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics).


Skills and Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of inventory control systems and best practices
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
	Strong leadership and team management abilities
	High attention to detail and organizational skills
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel and inventory reporting tools
	Good communication and collaboration skills
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
	Strong understanding of quality standards, food safety, and regulatory compliance


Expected Behavioural Traits:


	Accountability: Takes ownership of tasks and results
	Integrity: Honest and trustworthy in handling stock and records
	Proactiveness: Anticipates issues and acts to prevent them
	Efficiency: Delivers accurate results within required timeframes
	Discipline: Maintains process and documentation consistency
	Team Spirit: Works collaboratively across departments


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: vacancies@afshltd.com using "Inventory Manager – natnudO Foods" as the subject of the mail.

        natnudO has been revolutionizing the poultry industry for over 10 years. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the Nigerian market’s demand for high-quality animal protein. We provide a full range of high-quality, tasty animal protein products to satisfy our growing market. Our products offer great value for money while strictly following global best practices for food processing.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We maintain a high level of organizational excellence in all aspects of our business, from production to distribution, until the products get to our esteemed consumers. Every product is carefully processed and packaged according to the highest global health standards. All our products are NAFDAC and SON certified. natnudO Foods is growing to provide a diverse range of protein products for all our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Manager
Job Location: Awe, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	We are seeking a highly experienced and motivated Logistics Manager to oversee and manage all logistics operations for our organization. 
	This role is critical to ensuring the timely, efficient, and cost-effective delivery of our products, with a strong emphasis on food safety, regulatory compliance, and service excellence.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee end-to-end logistics operations, including inbound and outbound transportation, warehousing, and distribution.
	Develop and execute logistics strategies that drive efficiency, cost savings, and service quality.
	Manage and coordinate with 3rd logistics (3PL) providers, transporters, and internal warehouse teams.
	Lead the implementation and optimization of logistics systems and technology.
	Prepare and manage logistics budgets, identifying cost-saving opportunities while maintaining quality service delivery.
	Ensure all logistics operations comply with food safety standards and regulatory requirements.
	Track, analyze, and report logistics KPIs (e.g., delivery accuracy, lead times, logistics costs) to support data-driven decision-making.
	Collaborate with supply chain, production, and sales teams to ensure logistics is aligned with business objectives.
	Develop and train logistics staff to ensure team competence and operational excellence.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
	6-8 years of hands-on experience in logistics management, preferably within the food or FMCG sector.
	Professional logistics certifications (e.g., CLP, CILT) will be an added advantage.
	Proven experience managing fleets, 3PLs, or distribution networks, with a strong understanding of food handling and logistics compliance.


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Excellent knowledge of transportation, warehousing, and inventory systems
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and negotiation skills
	Proficiency in logistics software and ERP systems
	Strong leadership, team management, and interpersonal communication skills
	Familiarity with regulatory frameworks in food logistics.
	Budget management and contract negotiation expertise.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: vacancies@afshltd.com using "Logistics Manager Application" as the subject of the mail.

        AAA Finance and Investment Company Limited is a fast growing Finance House company established in 2018 and promoted by reputable investors. AA Finance and Investment Company limited is registered and licensed by Central Bank of Nigeria as a Finance House  to provide financial services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts & Finance Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	Proven track record of managing budgets, financial reporting, and audits.
	Proficient in financial management software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, Oracle Financials) and advanced knowledge of MS Excel and other financial modeling tools

                        Account Officer Job at O J Wale Pillars Metal and Tech Limited




        
    

        
        
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

O J Wale Pillars Metal and Tech Limited is a Nigerian-based Solar Energy Company that is focused on Providing sustainable uninterrupted alternative source of energy solutions for home and businesses across Nigeria and to ensure that it’s eco-friendly and totally free from noise pollution. Our source of energy ensures conservation of energy and quick power supply for immediate utilization for end users. O J Wale Pillars Metal and Tech Limited was registered on 24th of April 2015 with the Corporate Affairs Commission. However, we have been in the Solar energy business since 2010 (10 years ago), while Battery Hunters Limited as subsidiary was registered on 19th July, 2019. At O J Wale Pillars Metal and Tech Limited, we are known for innovative and exceptional after-sales service and support for all our Clients and customers through our seasoning Engineers and Customers Service representatives as we provide alternative energy solutions to each home, organizations, schools, industries, government agencies and non-governmental parasternal.

Our source of energy exists from Nature and that makes it absolutely free from causing any harm to the end user. No air pollution, No noise pollution and Nature does not fail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Oshodi / Mafoluku, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Invoice Processing & Payment Management


	Verify, code, and process vendor invoices accurately and efficiently.
	Ensure invoices are properly authorized and matched with purchase orders (POs) and delivery receipts.
	Process payments (checks, wire transfers, online payments) in compliance with company policies.
	Monitor payment deadlines to avoid late fees and maintain good vendor relationships.


Vendor & Supplier Management


	Maintain and update vendor accounts, including W-9/TIN verification.
	Respond to vendor inquiries and resolve discrepancies in billing or payments.
	Reconcile vendor statements and resolve outstanding issues.


Financial Record keeping & Reporting


	Maintain accurate and organized accounts payable records.
	Assist in month-end closing by preparing AP accruals and reconciliations.
	Generate AP aging reports and assist with cash flow forecasting.


Compliance & Internal Controls


	Ensure compliance with company policies, tax regulations, and accounting standards.
	Assist with internal and external audits by providing supporting documentation.
	Identify process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy in AP operations.


Coordination with Other Departments


	Work closely with procurement, project managers, and finance teams to verify invoice accuracy.
	Collaborate with the accounting team to ensure proper GL coding and expense allocation.


Qualifications & Skills
Education & Experience:


	Diploma or Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2+ years of experience in accounts payable, preferably in construction, electromechanical, or a related industry.
	Experience with ERP systems


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in MS Excel(VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables).
	Knowledge of accounting principles(GAAP/IFRS).
	Familiarity with tax regulations related to vendor payments (VAT, WHT).


Soft Skills:


	Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Good communication skills for vendor and internal team interactions.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ojwalesolar@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the
